data.title: Good service - Food so-so
data.text: Took the family for a meal on Tuesday.  The service was great, but the food was just OK!  Not bad food, but just like dozens of other "Hispanic food" restaurants.  Taco Tuesday special was good, and the kids food was to their liking, but my food and my wife's food was nothing to rave about.

data.title: AUTHENTIC MEXICAN!
data.text: I went here last weekend for a retirement/birthday party. I'd seen the place a million times, but had never eaten here. We were a party of about 30, and service was excellent!!! They have the NICEST waiters that served us at this event. When the food arrived, I was very pleased with how it looked and even more pleased when I took a bite. I had a tamal and a chile relleno with rice and beans and everything was really tasty! There's easy parking in their parking lot, as well as right on the street. Their bar is nice too. I liked the decor in this restaurant, it looked how a Mexican restaurant is supposed to look! Now that I've tasted their food and experienced their great service, I'll definitely be coming back here again!

data.title: Food is going downhill again…
data.text:
The last time I wrote a review for this restaurant it was glowing because they had just upgraded the food. We live in the area, and had been here several times and each time I went home and felt sick so we stopped going. We decided to try it again after many many months and the food was excellent and I felt fine afterwards.
However, my wife and I both went there again last week and both felt ill when we got home. On the positive side the waiters have worked there a long time and the service is excellent. Also, the margaritas are just wonderful. However, if you are going for the food my advice is don't...clearly something is wrong in their kitchen again.

data.title: great place for taco tuesday and groups
data.text: food is average and not pricey  taco tuesday is our day of choice with a good margarita and taco deal   the wait staff is friendly and flexible

data.title: Beautiful Grounds Fooled Me!
data.text: Hey! This is southern California and I found the worst burrito I ever ate. Salty and tasteless I was adding hot sauce just to salvage it for some flavor.

data.title: Hidden Mexican treasure
data.text: This gem is hidden across from the Santa Anita horse track. Inside offers a nice bar area, good size dining area and a couple of snapper rooms for groups. Our party of six had tamales, tostadas, and a couple of made to order dishes as well as drinks. Total bill was a very reasonable $100.00. Service was outstanding. This is a great find.

data.title: Yup it's terrible
data.text: 1st off the management is the worst, very unhappy people seem to work here, they look scared of something. Then the food sucks, how do you mess up Mexican food? Then my beer was warm. This place is on my list of restaurants never to go to again.

data.title: Salsa & Chips
data.text: We eat four rounds of salsa and love it so. We always love peppers, Serio was so nice and the service is always good and food. My husband had the beef taco and chili Relleno with rice  and beans. I had the chili Relleno and a cheese enchilada with rice and bean. There price and comos are great! We always have a great time at pepper. Good prices, Good food and Good atmosphere!

data.title: Great patio dining
data.text: With such great weather most of the time, the patio is great for a happy hour gathering and to hang around for hours eating great food and drinking great margaritas.

data.title: Very good neighborhood restaurant
data.text:
Although it is right across from Santa Anita racetrack, Peppers seems to attract a local crowd.  There is a decent sized sports bar area complete with happy hour and multiple televisions as well as a large dining area that is able to accommodate large groups as well as couples.

The menu is quite large with typical Mexican fare, and the sea food selections are excellent.  The service is friendly and helpful, and the Sunday brunch won't break the bank. Just wish there was more parking available…

data.title: viva marguerita
data.text:
this is our place for taco tues   alot of r egulars in the bar and our group in the diningroom  the food is average to above depending on the dish ordered   dietary concerns have lowered taste levels because of giving up the ingridients that make it
taste good   but the gang comes for the margaritas first and last and food is really
second  a fun place with good service and patient servers

data.title: Mexican Food after a visit to LA Arboretum
data.text: We ate at Peppers Mexican Restaurant after a visit to the LA Arboretum, about 3-5 minutes away.  They had a lunch special for $6.99, where you could choose your entree that came with rice and beans and the complimentary chips and salsa.  This was our most economical meal in LA!  The waiter was attentive and made suggestions. We will return again for the great food and service. We read that on Sundays they have a buffet that sounded wonderful.  This restaurant is across the street from the Santa Anita Raceway and near the mall.

data.title: Decent for lunch
data.text: Decent Tex-Mex. Lunch service was quick and the order was accurate. Price was reasonable for the food served. Lunch specials are a good value. I prefer getting something smaller from the A La Carte selection.

data.title: A Tex-Mex Wonderland of Mexican Food!
data.text:
If you find yourself in the Pasadena-Arcadia area, and you're a fan of Tex-Mex style Mexican food, then do yourself a favor and stop in to Peppers.  

This place has great ambiance (it looks like you stepped into Colonial Mexico; with the wagon wheels and the colorful  tapestries) and specializes in tasty food, big portions, and personable customer service. 

Let's start with the food, which is DELICIOSO!  Right as you sit, chips & salsa come automatically to the table -- which I love beyond words (most modern Mexican eateries are too fancy for this staple of the meal and tend to make your order it separately).  The salsa here is flavorful and fresh, and the guac is just right.  Chips come nice and hot out of the fryer.  

The main menu itself is laid out into app's, a la carte options, and combination plates.  I usually wind up going a la carte, so I can create a huge plate of four or five different items (some Mex restaurants call this the "El Presidente" plate).  The hard tacos were bigger than anticipated and extra crunchy.  The shredded beef enchiladas were super cheesy (in a good way) and served "wet style" with the red sauce baked in.  And the chicken taquitos were crispy on the outside and perfectly soft & moist on the inside. The rice is subtly flavored and does not have vegetables mixed in.  

I can't speak to the beans as I was too full at this point to sample them.  They looked great though with the white crumbly cheese sprinkled on top! 

Margaritas were a tad watered down, but the food more than made up for it! 

I have to give my compliments to the staff who were all pleasant and more than happy to welcome a party of tourists like ours and treat us as if we were regulars.        

Now, I've read some other reviews on here complaining about the prices and I have to disagree.  This is a perfectly affordable place with great-tasting food.  I think we paid less than 50 bucks for two of us -- and that was with margaritas, app's and entrees, and tip all rolled into one.

I don't know when I'll be back in Arcadia, but the next time I do, I'll most definitely be stopping by Peppers top say "Hola" and eat 'til my heart's content.

data.title: Needs to Re-Energize
data.text: Not long ago, Peppers was far and away the best Mexican restaurant in this part of the San Gabriel Valley. These days, it is sometimes just average. The food is not as consistent as it was, and the service has noticeably changed/declined. Not sure if this is due to change of ownership but it seems that you need to be seated in the bar to keep not just the beers coming but just to have your order handled promptly. That said, it is still a good place for kids and even large groups who are not seeking anything too fancy.

data.title: Little treat
data.text:
Been to peppers a few time when over to LA
Love the place nice mexican food and great  drinks
Staff good portion size on the large side
Have had a great  experience  here all the time
Belly full leaving

data.title: Skip this place
data.text: My family and I have eaten here for years, but as of late it has gone down hill. Our order was wrong, when they got it right it was cold. No one said anything or Reyes to make it right. That includes the manager, so if your at the track and want Mexican food drive a little and go to Paco's Mexican food. You stay you'll be sorry

data.title: The como's
data.text: I had the chill rellando and cheese enchilada with Spanish rice and beans. My husband had the tamale and beef taco with Spanish rice and beans. It was delicious and reasonably price. I had the ice tea and husband diet coke. They have a good variety menu of Mexican food and good variety of drinks. It was so nice they gave us a side dessert of cinnamon chips sprinkle with chocolate. A nice surprise. We always enjoy there food, excellent serve and prices. We will be back!S

data.title: large family gathering
data.text: we came to this restaurant after a funeral. 25 of us, no reservations, and we were seated right away, served quickly, and treated kindly.

data.title: almost weekly taco tuesday retreat
data.text:
this is an old reliable meeting place for taco tuesdays   it is right across from santa anita on the north side  it has good parking and the margaritas are good (that is according to those who drink)
for every marg you order you get a plate of small tacos which are pretty good    i often have a 
cheese enchilada and refried beans (those are great if you add cheese and onions on top) they taste like beans before everyone got health conscious  depending on who you get, the service is good and friendly  the decor is mildly mexican with lots of santa anita photos on the entry hall walls
